meanings.definition: Capable of being endured or tolerated.
meanings.sent1: The pain was bearable after taking the medicine.
meanings.sent2: The workload was bearable with proper time management.
meanings.sent3: The bearable wait for the bus seemed longer because of the rain.
meanings.sent4: Her smile made the bearable task of cleaning feel lighter.
meanings.sent5: The bearable heat of the sun warmed his skin gently.

meanings.definition: Able to be supported or carried.
meanings.sent1: The lightweight bag was bearable for the little girl to carry.
meanings.sent2: The sturdy shelf was bearable for holding heavy books.
meanings.sent3: The bearable weight of the groceries made her feel like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: His encouragement was the bearable support she needed to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The bearable load on his shoulders felt like a badge of honor.

meanings.definition: Tolerable; not too difficult or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The weather was bearable for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent2: The noise level in the cafe was bearable for studying.
meanings.sent3: The bearable taste of the new dish surprised her taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The bearable challenge of the puzzle kept her entertained for hours.
meanings.sent5: The bearable journey through the forest was filled with wonder.
